sentences.english: Danyun (Red-Cloud) Valley, a name which compares the red leaves to red clouds.
sentences.chinese: 丹云峡，把成片的红叶比作红色的云彩。

sentences.english: Nikko and the Okunikko area around Lake Chuzenji, in particular, are well known for their beautiful autumn colors (koyo).
sentences.chinese: 日光地区汤元及中禅寺湖的红叶特别著名。

sentences.english: Collapse treatment in section of Hongye-2 Hydroelectric Power Station headrace tunnel downstream of adit No.
sentences.chinese: 红叶二级水电站引水隧洞2号支洞下游塌方段处理。

sentences.english: Red leaves in autumn and snow in winter.
In this season, red Yuelu Mountain is most attractive for visitors.
sentences.chinese: 这个季节，红叶是岳麓山最吸引游人的景致。

sentences.english: Maple leaves float to fall wind sunset.
If the weather is good tomorrow, let's go see the red leaves.
sentences.chinese: 要是明天天气好，我们就去看红叶吧。

sentences.english: Hills are the most charming autumn scenery in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 香山红叶是北京最浓最浓的秋色。

sentences.english: Last autumn leaves lie in the chancellorship in Berlin.
sentences.chinese: 德国，柏林，依恋在爬墙虎上的最后几片红叶。

sentences.english: Autumn, a red maple sister falls, as if to meet a good year.
sentences.chinese: 秋天，枫树姐姐飘落着红叶，仿佛在迎接丰收的一年。

sentences.english: The novels written by "Poems on Red Leaf" in the Tang & Five Dynasties have long enjoyed popularity since their emergence.
sentences.chinese: 唐五代“红叶题诗”小说自它产生之日起便盛传不衰。

sentences.english: The leaves make the whole mountain seem red.
sentences.chinese: 红叶把整座山都染红了。

sentences.english: Our team will play against the front-running Red Leaves next month.
sentences.chinese: 我队将于下个月和领先的红叶队比赛。

sentences.english: Full Ying Guo, Woods Hongye dance autumn wind.
sentences.chinese: 万紫千红迎国庆，片片红叶舞秋风。

sentences.english: In the autumn, Beijing's Fragrance Hill is covered with red autumn leaves.
sentences.chinese: 在秋天，北京的香山被红叶所覆盖。

sentences.english: The maple leaves of the Xiangshan Mountain glowed red in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 香山红叶在阳光中闪耀着红光。

definition: autumn frost/fig. white hair as sign of old age
oriental cherry (Prunus serrulata or Prunus yedoensis), prized for its blossom/also known as sakura (Japanese) or Yoshino cherry
lit. covering the mountains and the plains (idiom)/fig. as far as the eye can see/covering everything/omnipresent
covering the whole land/over hills and dales
